result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan E Timoneda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements, each count.  Court ordered monies taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance would be then paid while on Extended supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against the defendant.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any current sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment and/or schooling for at least 40 hours a week.

No controlled substances or alcohol. 
No contact with the victims, Caleb H. and Jesus B.F.  No contact with coactors.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Urine screens to ensure compliance.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant he will have to provide a DNA sample to Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing, and pay surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other fireams; and that his voting rights are suspended ad may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one.
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program/Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program  after one (1) year incarceration. 
After completion of the programs, the defendant can be released 30 days after the  Court has been notified. Balance of confinement time can be added onto Extended Supervision.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan E Timoneda

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (30 pages) commencing OCTOBER 1, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Jonathan E Timoneda in court with Attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Jonathan E Timoneda in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Plea/Sentencing hearing.  As to plea:  AS TO COUNT #1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
  
AS TO COUNT #2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT #1:  The Court imposed the following sentence:  The Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be FOUR (4) years CONSECUTIVE to any current sentence.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for TWO (2) years.  Defendant shall serve TWO (2) years on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  

AS TO COUNT #2:  The Court imposed the following sentence:  The Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be FOUR (4) years CONSECUTIVE to Count #1.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for TWO (2) years.  Defendant shall serve TWO (2) years on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  

The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program AFTER ONE (1) year incarceration.  
The defendant ist eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program AFTER ONE (1) year incarceration.

After completion of the programs, the Defendant can be released THIRTY (30) days after the Court has been notified and balance of confinement time can be added on to extended supervision.
  
The Court advised the defendant of the determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form CR-234.  Copy provided to defendant. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
 - No controlled substances or alcohol; Absolute sobriety;
 - AODA assessment; treatment, if needed;
 - Urine screens to ensure compliance;
 - Seek and maintain employment and/or schooling for at least 40 hours a week;
 - No contact with the victims, Caleb H. and Jesus B.F.; No contact with co-actors;
 - Restitution is set at ZERO.
 - 50 hours of community service; 
 - Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements.  Court ordered monies taken by the Department of Correction from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance would be then be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against the Defendant.

Filed,
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Jonathan E Timoneda in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Sara Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court orders under local rule 1.4 case transferred to Branch 30 forthwith.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Jonathan E Timoneda not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Case in court for plea and sentencing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
At the court's request, and without objection from the state or defense, plea and sentencing is moved from 07/10/2015 at 8:30am to 07/09/2015 at 1:30pm.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Jonathan E Timoneda not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

Defendant Jonathan E Timoneda in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Jonathan E Timoneda in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Moroney.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Witkowiak, Br. 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Caleb H. or Jesus BF

Defendant Jonathan E Timoneda in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Jonathan E Timoneda in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

Commissioner advised DNA sample has not been obtained.  Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain sample.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample date expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4)


  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
